title: How the COVID-19 Vaccines Were Made So Quickly
author: Health com
description: "The only path forward to actually getting our society back to normal is a vaccine," Ross Kedl, professor of immunology and microbiology at University of Colorado Anschutz School of Medicine, tells Health. "There has never been an infection against which we've achieved herd immunity without one."
sitename: University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus
cleaned_text: On December 14, nine months after the pandemic forced the nation into quarantine, an intensive care nurse named [Sandra Lindsay](https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/14/nyregion/us-covid-vaccine-first-sandra-lindsay.html) made history. Lindsay, the director of critical care nursing at Long Island Jewish Medical Center in New York, became the first person in the United States to receive a [COVID-19 vaccine](https://www.health.com/condition/infectious-diseases/coronavirus/is-the-covid-19-vaccine-safe-for-everyone) outside of a clinical trial. CU Anschutz Fitzsimons
